verses.text: Now these \add are\add* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of the \w province|strong="H4082"\w* that went \w up|strong="H5927"\w* out of the \w captivity|strong="H7628"\w*, of those which had been carried \w away|strong="H1473"\w*, whom \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* had carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w* unto \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w*, and came \w again|strong="H7725"\w* unto \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* and \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, every \w one|strong="H0376"\w* unto his \w city|strong="H5892"\w*;

Which \w came|strong="H0935"\w* with \w Zerubbabel|strong="H2216"\w*: \w Jeshua|strong="H3442"\w*, \w Nehemiah|strong="H5166"\w*, \w Seraiah|strong="H8304"\w*, \w Reelaiah|strong="H7480"\w*, \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, \w Bilshan|strong="H1114"\w*, \w Mispar|strong="H4558"\w*, \w Bigvai|strong="H0902"\w*, \w Rehum|strong="H7348"\w*, \w Baanah|strong="H1196"\w*. The \w number|strong="H4557"\w* of the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*:\f + \fr 2.2 \ft Seraiah: also called, Azariah\f*\f + \fr 2.2 \ft Reelaiah: or, Raamiah\f*\f + \fr 2.2 \ft Mispar: or, Mispereth\f*\f + \fr 2.2 \ft Rehum: or, Nehum\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Parosh|strong="H6551"\w*, two \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shephatiah|strong="H8203"\w*, \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Arah|strong="H0733"\w*, \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Pahath-moab|strong="H6355"\w*, of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jeshua|strong="H3442"\w* \add and\add* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, two \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w eight|strong="H8083"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Elam|strong="H5867"\w*, a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w four|strong="H0702"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zattu|strong="H2240"\w*, \w nine|strong="H8672"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zaccai|strong="H2140"\w*, \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w threescore|strong="H8346"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Bani|strong="H1137"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.\f + \fr 2.10 \ft Bani: also called, Binnui\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Bebai|strong="H0893"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Azgad|strong="H5803"\w*, a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Adonikam|strong="H0140"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w sixty|strong="H8346"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Bigvai|strong="H0902"\w*, two \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Adin|strong="H5720"\w*, \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w four|strong="H0702"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ater|strong="H0333"\w* of \w Hezekiah|strong="H3169"\w*, \w ninety|strong="H8673"\w* and \w eight|strong="H8083"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Bezai|strong="H1209"\w*, \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jorah|strong="H3139"\w*, an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w*.\f + \fr 2.18 \ft Jorah: also called, Hariph\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hashum|strong="H2828"\w*, two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Gibbar|strong="H1402"\w*, \w ninety|strong="H8673"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*.\f + \fr 2.20 \ft Gibbar: also called, Gibeon\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Beth-lehem|strong="H1035"\w*, an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.
The \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Netophah|strong="H5199"\w*, \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w*.
The \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Anathoth|strong="H6068"\w*, an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w eight|strong="H8083"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Azmaveth|strong="H5820"\w*, \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.\f + \fr 2.24 \ft Azmaveth: also called, Beth-azmaveth\f*

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Kirjath-arim|strong="H7157"\w*, \w Chephirah|strong="H3716"\w*, and \w Beeroth|strong="H0881"\w*, \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ramah|strong="H7414"\w* and \w Gaba|strong="H1387"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w one|strong="H0259"\w*.
The \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Michmas|strong="H4363"\w*, an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of \w Beth-el|strong="H1008"\w* and \w Ai|strong="H5857"\w*, two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nebo|strong="H5015"\w*, \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Magbish|strong="H4019"\w*, an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of the \w other|strong="H0312"\w* \w Elam|strong="H5867"\w*, a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w four|strong="H0702"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Harim|strong="H2766"\w*, \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Lod|strong="H3850"\w*, \w Hadid|strong="H2307"\w*, and \w Ono|strong="H0207"\w*, \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*.\f + \fr 2.33 \ft Hadid: or, Harid, as it is in some copies\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jericho|strong="H3405"\w*, \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*.

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Senaah|strong="H5570"\w*, \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w*.

¶ The \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jedaiah|strong="H3048"\w*, of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w Jeshua|strong="H3442"\w*, \w nine|strong="H8672"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* and \w three|strong="H7969"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Immer|strong="H0564"\w*, a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Pashur|strong="H6583"\w*, a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w seven|strong="H7651"\w*.
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Harim|strong="H2766"\w*, a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* and \w seventeen|strong="H7651"\w*.

¶ The \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jeshua|strong="H3442"\w* and \w Kadmiel|strong="H6934"\w*, of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hodaviah|strong="H1938"\w*, \w seventy|strong="H7657"\w* and \w four|strong="H0702"\w*.\f + \fr 2.40 \ft Hodaviah: also called, Judah or Hodevah\f*
¶ The \w singers|strong="H7891"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Asaph|strong="H0623"\w*, an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* and \w eight|strong="H8083"\w*.

¶ The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of the \w porters|strong="H7778"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shallum|strong="H7967"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ater|strong="H0333"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Talmon|strong="H2929"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Akkub|strong="H6126"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hatita|strong="H2410"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shobai|strong="H7630"\w*, \add in\add* all an \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w nine|strong="H8672"\w*.

¶ The \w Nethinims|strong="H5411"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ziha|strong="H6727"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hasupha|strong="H2817"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Tabbaoth|strong="H2884"\w*,

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Keros|strong="H7026"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Siaha|strong="H5517"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Padon|strong="H6303"\w*,\f + \fr 2.44 \ft Siaha: also called, Sia\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Lebanah|strong="H3838"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hagabah|strong="H2286"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Akkub|strong="H6126"\w*,

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hagab|strong="H2285"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shalmai|strong="H8073"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hanan|strong="H2605"\w*,\f + \fr 2.46 \ft Shalmai: also called, Shamlai\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Giddel|strong="H1435"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Gahar|strong="H1515"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Reaiah|strong="H7211"\w*,
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Rezin|strong="H7526"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nekoda|strong="H5353"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Gazzam|strong="H1502"\w*,
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Uzza|strong="H5798"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Paseah|strong="H6454"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Besai|strong="H1153"\w*,

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Asnah|strong="H0619"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Mehunim|strong="H4586"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nephusim|strong="H5300"\w*,\f + \fr 2.50 \ft Nephusim: also called, Nephishesim\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Bakbuk|strong="H1227"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hakupha|strong="H2709"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Harhur|strong="H2744"\w*,

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Bazluth|strong="H1213"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Mehida|strong="H4240"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Harsha|strong="H2797"\w*,\f + \fr 2.52 \ft Bazluth: also called, Bazlith\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Barkos|strong="H1302"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Sisera|strong="H5516"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Thamah|strong="H8547"\w*,
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Neziah|strong="H5335"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hatipha|strong="H2412"\w*.

¶ The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Solomon’s|strong="H8010"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Sotai|strong="H5479"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Sophereth|strong="H5618"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Peruda|strong="H6514"\w*,\f + \fr 2.55 \ft Peruda: also called, Perida\f*
The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jaalah|strong="H3279"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Darkon|strong="H1874"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Giddel|strong="H1435"\w*,

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shephatiah|strong="H8203"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Hattil|strong="H2411"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of Pochereth of \w Zebaim|strong="H6380"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ami|strong="H0532"\w*.\f + \fr 2.57 \ft Ami: also called, Amon\f*

All the \w Nethinims|strong="H5411"\w*, and the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Solomon’s|strong="H8010"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, \add were\add* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w ninety|strong="H8673"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.

And these \add were\add* they which went \w up|strong="H5927"\w* from \w Tel-melah|strong="H8528"\w*, \w Tel-harsa|strong="H8521"\w*, \w Cherub|strong="H3743"\w*, \w Addan|strong="H0135"\w*, \add and\add* \w Immer|strong="H0564"\w*: but they \w could|strong="H3201"\w* not \w shew|strong="H5046"\w* their \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and their \w seed|strong="H2233"\w*, whether they \add were\add* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*:\f + \fr 2.59 \ft Addan: also called, Addon\f*\f + \fr 2.59 \ft seed: or, pedigree\f*

The \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Delaiah|strong="H1806"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Tobiah|strong="H2900"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nekoda|strong="H5353"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w fifty|strong="H2572"\w* and \w two|strong="H8147"\w*.

¶ And of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*: the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Habaiah|strong="H2252"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Koz|strong="H6976"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w*; which \w took|strong="H3947"\w* a \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* of the \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Barzillai|strong="H1271"\w* the \w Gileadite|strong="H1569"\w*, and was \w called|strong="H7121"\w* after their \w name|strong="H8034"\w*:

These \w sought|strong="H1245"\w* their \w register|strong="H3791"\w* \add among\add* those that were reckoned by \w genealogy|strong="H3187"\w*, but they were not \w found|strong="H4672"\w*: therefore were they, as \w polluted|strong="H1351"\w*, put from the \w priesthood|strong="H3550"\w*.\f + \fr 2.62 \ft were they…: Heb. they were polluted from the priesthood\f*

And the \w Tirshatha|strong="H8660"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, that they should not \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* of the \w most|strong="H6944"\w* holy \w things|strong="H6944"\w*, till there stood \w up|strong="H5975"\w* a \w priest|strong="H3548"\w* with \w Urim|strong="H0224"\w* and with \w Thummim|strong="H8550"\w*.\f + \fr 2.63 \ft Tirshatha: or, governor\f*

¶ The whole \w congregation|strong="H6951"\w* \w together|strong="H0259"\w* \add was\add* \w forty|strong="H0702"\w* and two \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \add and\add* \w threescore|strong="H8346"\w*,

Beside their \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* and their \w maids|strong="H0519"\w*, of whom \add there were\add* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w seven|strong="H7651"\w*: and \add  \+w there were|strong="H0428"\+w*\add* among them two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* singing \w men|strong="H7891"\w* and singing \w women|strong="H7891"\w*.

Their \w horses|strong="H5483"\w* \add were\add* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w six|strong="H8337"\w*; their \w mules|strong="H6505"\w*, two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*;

Their \w camels|strong="H1581"\w*, \w four|strong="H0702"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w thirty|strong="H7970"\w* and \w five|strong="H2568"\w*; \add their\add* \w asses|strong="H2543"\w*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* and \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w*.

¶ And \add some\add* of the \w chief|strong="H7218"\w* of the \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*, when they \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which \add is\add* at \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, offered \w freely|strong="H5068"\w* for the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w* to set it \w up|strong="H5975"\w* in his \w place|strong="H4349"\w*:

They \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* after their \w ability|strong="H3581"\w* unto the \w treasure|strong="H0214"\w* of the \w work|strong="H4399"\w* \w threescore|strong="H8337"\w* and one \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w drams|strong="H1871"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w*, and \w five|strong="H2568"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w pound|strong="H4488"\w* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and one \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w priests’|strong="H3548"\w* \w garments|strong="H3801"\w*.

So the \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*, and the \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w*, and \add some\add* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and the \w singers|strong="H7891"\w*, and the \w porters|strong="H7778"\w*, and the \w Nethinims|strong="H5411"\w*, \w dwelt|strong="H3427"\w* in their \w cities|strong="H5892"\w*, and all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* in their \w cities|strong="H5892"\w*.
